title: Amazon GuardDuty (Preview)
descriptionMarkdown: The Amazon GuardDuty data connector provides the capability to ingest [Amazon GuardDuty](https://aws.amazon.com/guardduty/) findings into Azure Sentinel using the Amazon GuardDuty REST API. Refer to [API documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/guardduty/latest/APIReference/Welcome.html) for more information.
additionalRequirementBanner: These queries and workbooks are dependent on a parser based on Kusto to work as expected. Follow the steps to use this Kusto functions alias **AWSGuardDuty** in queries and workbooks. [Follow steps to get this Kusto functions>](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/socprime/Azure-Sentinel/GuardDutyDataConnector/Parsers/AWSGuardDuty/AWSGuardDuty)

dataTypes.name: AWSGuardDuty_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
AWSGuardDuty_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
AWSGuardDuty_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key)

customs.name: Microsoft.Web/sites permissions
customs.description: Read and write permissions to Azure Functions to create a Function App is required. [See the documentation to learn more about Azure Functions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-functions/).

customs.name: Amazon GuardDuty REST API Credentials/permissions
customs.description: **AWS Access Key Id**, **AWS Secret Access Key**, **AWS Region Name** are required for Amazon GuardDuty REST API. [See the documentation to learn more about creating Access Keys in AWS.](https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/create-access-key/) Note that AWS credentials must have read access to Amazon GuardDuty.

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This connector uses Azure Functions to connect to the Amazon GuardDuty REST API to pull logs into Azure Sentinel. This might result in additional data ingestion costs. Check the [Azure Functions pricing page](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/functions/) for details.

>**(Optional Step)** Securely store workspace and API authorization key(s) or token(s) in Azure Key Vault. Azure Key Vault provides a secure mechanism to store and retrieve key values. [Follow these instructions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/app-service-key-vault-references) to use Azure Key Vault with an Azure Function App.

>**NOTE:** This connector uses a parser based on a Kusto Function to normalize fields. [Follow these steps](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/socprime/Azure-Sentinel/GuardDutyDataConnector/Parsers/AWSGuardDuty/AWSGuardDuty) to create the Kusto function alias **AWSGuardDuty**.

**STEP 1 - Creating AWS Access Key for Amazon GuardDuty**

[See the documentation to learn more about creating Access Keys in AWS.](https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/create-access-key/) Note that AWS credentials must have read access to Amazon GuardDuty.

**STEP 2 - Choose ONE from the following two deployment options to deploy the connector and the associated Azure Function**

>**IMPORTANT:** Before deploying the Amazon GuardDuty data connector, have the Workspace ID and Workspace Primary Key (can be copied from the following), as well as the Amazon GuardDuty REST API Authorization credentials, readily available.

instructionSteps.title: Option 1 - Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Template
instructionSteps.description:
Use this method for automated deployment of the Amazon GuardDuty data connector using an ARM Tempate.

1. Click the **Deploy to Azure** button below. 

	[![Deploy To Azure](https://aka.ms/deploytoazurebutton)](https://aka.ms/sentinelguarddutyazuredeploy)
2. Select the preferred **Subscription**, **Resource Group** and **Location**. 
3. Enter the **AWS Access Key Id**, **AWS Secret Access Key**, **AWS Region Name**, **Azure Sentinel Workspace Id**, **Azure Sentinel Shared Key**
4. Mark the checkbox labeled **I agree to the terms and conditions stated above**.
5. Click **Purchase** to deploy.

instructionSteps.title: Option 2 - Manual Deployment of Azure Functions
instructionSteps.description: Use the following step-by-step instructions to deploy the Amazon GuardDuty data connector manually with Azure Functions (Deployment via Visual Studio Code).

**1. Deploy a Function App**

> **NOTE:** You will need to [prepare VS code](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-functions/create-first-function-vs-code-python) for Azure function development.

1. Download the [Azure Function App](https://github.com/socprime/Azure-Sentinel/blob/GuardDutyDataConnector/DataConnectors/AWSGuardDuty/GuardDutyConn.zip?raw=true) file. Extract archive to your local development computer.
2. Start VS Code. Choose File in the main menu and select Open Folder.
3. Select the top level folder from extracted files.
4. Choose the Azure icon in the Activity bar, then in the **Azure: Functions** area, choose the **Deploy to function app** button.
If you aren't already signed in, choose the Azure icon in the Activity bar, then in the **Azure: Functions** area, choose **Sign in to Azure**
If you're already signed in, go to the next step.
5. Provide the following information at the prompts:

	a. **Select folder:** Choose a folder from your workspace or browse to one that contains your function app.

	b. **Select Subscription:** Choose the subscription to use.

	c. Select **Create new Function App in Azure** (Don't choose the Advanced option)

	d. **Enter a globally unique name for the function app:** Type a name that is valid in a URL path. The name you type is validated to make sure that it's unique in Azure Functions. (e.g. UmbrellaXYZ).

	e. **Select a runtime:** Choose Python 3.8.

	f. Select a location for new resources. For better performance and lower costs choose the same [region](https://azure.microsoft.com/regions/) where Azure Sentinel is located.

6. Deployment will begin. A notification is displayed after your function app is created and the deployment package is applied.
7. Go to Azure Portal for the Function App configuration.

**2. Configure the Function App**

1. In the Function App, select the Function App Name and select **Configuration**.
2. In the **Application settings** tab, select **+ New application setting**.
3. Add each of the following application settings individually, with their respective string values (case-sensitive): 
		AWSAccessKeyId
		AWSSecretAccessKey
		AWSRegionName
		AzureSentinelWorkspaceId
		AzureSentinelSharedKey
3. Once all application settings have been entered, click **Save**.
